gov.nist.csd.pm.pdp.services

Class GraphService

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.csd.pm.pdp.services.Service
      • gov.nist.csd.pm.pdp.services.GraphService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph, Search

    public class GraphService
extends Service
implements Graph, Search
    GraphService provides methods to maintain an NGAC graph, while also ensuring any user interacting with the graph, has the correct permissions to do so.

    • Method Detail

      • createNode

        public long createNode(NodeContext ctx)
                throws PMException
        Create a node and assign it to the node with the given ID. The name and type must not be null. This method is needed because if a node is created without an initial assignment, it will be impossible to assign the node in the future since no user will have permissions on a node not connected to the graph. In this method we can check the user has the permission to assign to the given parent node and ignore if the user can assign the newly created node. When creating a policy class, a parent node is not required. The user must have the "create policy class" permission on the super object. By default the super user will always have this permission. A object attribute that represents the policy class will be created and assigned to the super object attribute. In the future, when any user attempts to perform an action on the policy class they will need to have permission on this representative node. If the parent node is a policy class, check the permissions the current user has on the representative of the policy class.
        Specified by:
        createNode in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context information for the node to create. This includes the parentID, name, type, and properties.
        Returns:
        The new node created with it's ID.
        Throws:
        PMException - If the NodeContext parameter is null.
        PMException - If the NodeContext's name field is null or empty.
        PMException - If the NodeContext's type field is null.
        PMException - If a node already exists with the given name, type, and namespace property.
        PMException - If the current user does not have permission to create the node.

      • updateNode

        public void updateNode(NodeContext node)
                throws PMException
        Update the node in the database and in the in-memory graph
        Specified by:
        updateNode in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        node - The context of the node to update. This includes the id, name, type, and properties.
        Throws:
        PMException - If the given node is null.
        PMException - If the given node does not have an ID.

      • deleteNode

        public void deleteNode(long nodeID)
                throws PMException
        Delete the node with the given ID from the db and in-memory graphs. First check that the current user has the correct permissions to do so. Do this by checking that the user has the permission to deassign from each of the node's parents, and that the user can delete the node. If the node is a Policy Class or is assigned to a Policy Class, check the permissions on the representative node.
        Specified by:
        deleteNode in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the ID of the node to delete.
        Throws:
        PMException - If there is an error deleting the node.

      • exists

        public boolean exists(long nodeID)
               throws PMException
        Check that a node with the given ID exists. Just checking the in-memory graph is faster.
        Specified by:
        exists in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the ID of the node to check for.
        Returns:
        True if a node with the given ID exists, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        PMException - If there is an error checking if the node exists.

      • getNodes

        public java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> getNodes()
                                        throws PMException
        Retrieve the list of all nodes in the graph. Go to the database to do this, since it is more likely to have all of the node information.
        Specified by:

      • getChildren

        public java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> getChildren(long nodeID)
                                           throws PMException
        Get the children of the node from the graph. Get the children from the database to ensure all node information is present. Before returning the set of nodes, filter out any nodes that the user has no permissions on.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The ID of the node to get the children of.
        Returns:
        The Set of NGACNodes that are assigned to the node with the given ID.
        Throws:
        PMException - If there is an error getting the children of the given node.

      • assign

        public void assign(NodeContext childCtx,
                   NodeContext parentCtx)
            throws PMException
        Create the assignment in both the db and in-memory graphs. First check that the user is allowed to assign the child, and allowed to assign something to the parent. Both child and parent contexts must include the ID and type of the node.
        Specified by:
        assign in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        childCtx - The context information for the child node.
        parentCtx - The context information for the parent node.
        Throws:
        PMException - If the child node is null.
        PMException - If the parent node is null.
        PMException - If the child node does not have an ID or type.
        PMException - If the parent node does not have an ID or type.
        PMException - If the child node does not exist.
        PMException - If the parent node does not exist.
        PMException - If the assignment is invalid.
        PMException - If the current user does not have permission to create the assignment.

      • associate

        public void associate(NodeContext uaCtx,
                      NodeContext targetCtx,
                      java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> operations)
               throws PMException
        Create an association between the User Attribute and the target node with the given operations. First, check that the user has the permissions to associate the user attribute and target nodes. If an association already exists between the two nodes than update the existing association with the provided operations (overwrite).
        Specified by:
        associate in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        uaCtx - The context information of the User Attribute.
        targetCtx - The information for the target node.
        operations - A Set of operations to add to the Association.
        Throws:
        PMException - If the user attribute node is null.
        PMException - If the target node is null.
        PMException - If the user attribute node does not have an ID or type.
        PMException - If the target node does not have an ID or type.
        PMException - If the user attribute node does not exist.
        PMException - If the target node does not exist.
        PMException - If the association is invalid.
        PMException - If the current user does not have permission to create the association.

      • dissociate

        public void dissociate(NodeContext uaCtx,
                       NodeContext targetCtx)
                throws PMException
        Delete the association between the user attribute and the target node. First, check that the user has the permission to delete the association.
        Specified by:

        PMException - If the target node does not have an ID.
        PMException - If the user attribute node does not exist.
        PMException - If the target node does not exist.
        PMException - If the current user does not have permission to delete the association.

                                                                                            throws PMException

      • search

        public java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> search(java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String type,
                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                                      throws PMException
        Search the NGAC graph for nodes that match the given parameters. The given search parameters are provided in the URI as query parameters. The parameters name and type are extracted from the URI and passed as parameters to the search function. Any other query parameters found in the URI will be added to the search criteria as node properties. A node must match all non null parameters to be returned in the search.
        Specified by:
        search in interface Search
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the nodes to search for.
        type - The type of the nodes to search for.
        properties - The properties of the nodes to search for.
        Returns:
        A Response with the nodes that match the given search criteria.
        Throws:
        PMException - If there is an error searching for nodes.

      • getNode

        public NodeContext getNode(long id)
                    throws PMException
        Retrieve the node from the graph with the given ID.
        Specified by:
        getNode in interface Search
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the node to get.
        Returns:
        The Node retrieved from the graph with the given ID.
        Throws:
        PMException - If the node does not exist in the graph.
        PMException - If the node is a Policy Class that doesn't have a rep node.
